_header: Three flowers in a night gan spring
_description: Fragment of an allegory, probably religious — five lines only

HunHM19999.Transcription:
Thre flourys in a nyȝt can spryngffrome euery floure a streme
                    rennyngA clerk a mong the flourys lyyngHem fond but noȝt durst
                    say nor syngffor drede of the Mone
HunHM19999.Note:
Added to what was originally end pastedown by a hand of the fiteenth
                    century, at the end of a volume of Gregory IX, Decretals.
HunHM19999.Editions:
Herbert,  John Alexander. 
             Catalogue of Romances in the Department of MSS. in the British
                Museum.
         Vol. 3. London, 1910. 
Robbins,  Rossell Hope. 
             “Poems Dealing with Contemporary Conditions.” 
             A Manual of the Writings in Middle English.
            Albert E. Hartung, ed. 
         Vol. 5, fascicle 13. New Haven, CT: Connecticut Academy of Arts and
            Sciences, 1975: 1385-1536, 1631-1725: 1535.
